message: I had a friend in Readify talk about it as well. anyone used it before?
story: Meligy shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: LaTeX: the professional tool for scientific writing
caption: youtube.com

data.message: What's the experience like? How do you start, and how do you get to a final product? How is the experience compared to current capabilities of MS Word like making sure you only use defined styles so you can change them globally later)

you shouldn't compare the two systems .. I use latex all the time for any thing require an equation .. and I used it without knowing too much about its programming .. i am using http://www.lyx.org/  after installing http://miktex.org/  .. another interesting site is https://www.writelatex.com/  
as I told before equations are the most powerful thing in latex  .. and ofcourse all publishing companies are using it.

We are sometimes forced in GUC to use LaTeX for various project reports and when writing our Thesis.
You can think of LaTeX like Markdown but for scientists instead of developers, it's a syntax that can be processed into PDF (or maybe other formats, I'm not sure). Lyx can be thought of as MarkdownPad for LaTeX.
I've used Lyx because I didn't really want to learn the syntax of LaTeX and did want to use commands or an eclipse plugin to render/export what I wrote to PDF or whatever.

It easier to write mathematical equations in LaTex than any other word processing but I don't recommend it if your content does not contains equations or only very simple ones. In LaTex you write something similar to HTML and then compile it to output PDF at the end.
